Brembo "plays it by ear" with cagey 2024 sales forecastItaly's Brembo offered a cautious outlook on Tuesday, guiding for mid-single digit revenue growth this year, in line with its performance for 2023, as geopolitical and commercial tensions allow limited visibility on future business prospects. Tue, 05 Mar 2024 17:18:14 GMT KXO34QRYKFMJJAVCIIZLC23YQE https://www.reuters.com/business/auto-transportation/brembo-plays-it-by-ear-with-cagey-2024-sales-forecast-2024-03-05/Reuters商业汽车与交通
Lawmakers seek to force ByteDance to divest TikTok or face US banA bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers is introducing legislation on Tuesday that would give China's ByteDance about six months to divest popular short video app TikTok or face a U.S. ban. Tue, 05 Mar 2024 17:14:08 GMT NMHBMKFVJZOCRGI4SRZZHKAVNU https://www.reuters.com/technology/lawmakers-seek-force-bytedance-divest-tiktok-or-face-us-ban-2024-03-05/David Shepardson, Michael Martina技术
Global home prices set for a gentle climb in a tight market - Reuters pollHome prices in most major property markets will rise modestly this year and next, according to a Reuters poll of housing specialists, who expected the shortage of affordable homes to persist for at least another two to three years. Tue, 05 Mar 2024 13:30:38 GMT N4HLQJNFEFOADA6EVF4ROUND3P4 https://www.reuters.com/markets/poll-global-home-prices-set-gentle-climb-tight-market-2024-03-05/Hari Kishan市场宏观问题
Russia says it is considering putting a nuclear power plant on the moon with ChinaRussia and China are considering putting a nuclear power plant on the moon from 2033-35, Yuri Borisov, the head of Russia's space agency Roscosmos said on Tuesday, something he said could one day allow lunar settlements to be built. Tue, 05 Mar 2024 12:28:07 GMT XYQQ2OEXJKMBDDOC52UTALXFI https://www.reuters.com/technology/space/Russia-china-are-considering-putting-nuclear-power-unit-moon-ria-2024-03-05/Reuters技术空间
Singapore's Temasek in talks to invest in OpenAI, FT reportsSingapore's Temasek Holdings is in discussions to invest in Microsoft-backed artificial intelligence company OpenAI, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday, citing two people familiar with the matter.
